page.title: 11BLACKHALL,EDINBURGH.
page.content: Ancient maps and charters show that there were once two villages in this vicinity. They were called{Kirk Road {Haugh}and{Clarty Hole,}which later became Blackhall.Today Blackhall is a {mainly residential}area of Edinburgh. Which is situated a few miles west of the city centre.Most of the houses are {privately owned}and they are peacefully sandwiched between two of the city's busier roads.The main village of Blackhall is built snugly in a dip on the{Queensferry Road}and has a variety of shops including restaurants,clothes shops, banks and grocers.The typical Blackhall family lives in fairly comfortable house with {approximately four bedrooms.}These houses are either{terraced ,bungalows, {or villas.}All of them have reasonably sized gardens and most have garages.
